recipes.label: Remains of Another Vessel
recipes.startdescription: We reach an area where the sea is cluttered like a workshop floor. Ships collided here, and what was once their hull and insides is spilled out to open air and sea. I can approach this challenge with knock or forge.

recipes.label: Salvage from the Wreck
recipes.startdescription: The sea carries many gifts, it is said. With net and hook and cable, we fish what can still be of use out of the water.

recipes.label: Nothing of Note
recipes.startdescription: The Sea is a fickle provider, it is said. We spend some time salvaging, but find nothing worth anything except as a soggy souvenir. We continue.

recipes.label: Scrape on the Hull
recipes.startdescription: moving through this field of debris is a delicate maneuvre, and the constelation of scrap was ill-omened today. A screeching sound and horrible tremble indicate that an unseen danger has breached the hull.
